meanings.definition: Resembling snow in appearance or texture.
meanings.sent1: The soft, snowlike blanket covered the ground.
meanings.sent2: Her hair was so white and snowlike, it shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The snowlike clouds drifted lazily across the sky.
meanings.sent4: The chef sprinkled powdered sugar on the cake, creating a snowlike effect.
meanings.sent5: The snowlike petals of the cherry blossoms fell gently to the ground.

meanings.sent1: The snowlike confetti rained down on the parade.
meanings.sent2: Her laughter filled the room, light and snowlike in its joy.
meanings.sent3: The snowlike feathers floated gracefully to the ground.
meanings.sent4: The music notes danced in the air, snowlike in their delicate descent.
meanings.sent5: The firework sparks sparkled in the night sky, snowlike in their beauty.

meanings.definition: To cover or be covered with something resembling snow.
meanings.sent1: She would snowlike the cupcakes with powdered sugar before serving.
meanings.sent2: The garden was snowlike with cherry blossom petals after the windstorm.
meanings.sent3: The children loved to snowlike each other with flour during the baking class.
meanings.sent4: The artist would snowlike the canvas with tiny dots of paint to create a unique texture.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peaks were snowlike with fresh snow, glistening in the morning sun.
